intro: Gilia arenaria, commonly known as the sand gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and narrow leaves. Gilia arenaria is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
